Intervention: All subjects will undergo standard breast care imaging. The other breast will be represented by patient-assisted compression (PAC), followed by technologist-controlled compression (TC).

The technologist will properly place the breast and apply minimal compression. The subject will be responsible for applying compression, as the technologist ensures that the breast tissue is in good position and tenacity. The technologist will then guide the subject to obtain an appropriate level of compression, sufficient but not excessive, and the image will be acquired. This will be done for both standard CC & MLO views.
All participants in the study: Compression Technologist
All subjects will undergo standard breast care imaging. The other breast will be represented by patient-assisted compression (PAC), followed by technologist-controlled compression (TC).
• Technologist-controlled compression (TC): The compression of TC will be performed according to the standard of care practices at the site.
Eligibility: Women are 40 years of age or older;
Are asymptomatic and programmed for screening mammography;
Have breast sizes compatible with the dimensions of an image detector of 24 x 31 cm, without anatomical cut;
Are documented as non-pregnant on the basis of the investigator's medical judgement and taking into account local clinical practice standards for proof of non-pregnantness;
Be able and willing to comply with study procedures; and
Be able and willing to provide written informed consent to participate.
Women are 40 years of age or older;
Are asymptomatic and programmed for screening mammography;
Have breast sizes compatible with the dimensions of an image detector of 24 x 31 cm, without anatomical cut;
Are documented as non-pregnant on the basis of the investigator's medical judgement and taking into account local clinical practice standards for proof of non-pregnantness;
Be able and willing to comply with study procedures; and
Be able and willing to provide written informed consent to participate.
Results: Performance measures:
Percentage of overall acceptable image quality

The main objective is to compare the percentage of acceptable overall image quality in breast images to two unilateral visions (CC and MLO) acquired using patient-assisted compression and technologist compression modes.
Time limit: 1 day
Results 1:
Title of the arm/group: All participants in the study: Patient-assisted compression

Description of the arm and group: All subjects will undergo standard imaging on one breast. The other breast will be represented using patient-assisted compression (PAC), followed by technologist-controlled compression (TC).

The technologist will properly place the breast and apply minimal compression. The subject will be responsible for applying compression, as the technologist ensures that the breast tissue is in good position and tenacity. The technologist will then guide the subject to obtain an appropriate level of compression, sufficient but not excessive, and the image will be acquired. This will be done for both standard CC & MLO views.
Total number of participants analysed: 33
Type of measure: Number of participants
Unit of measure: Participants Image quality: Acceptable: 30 90.9%
Quality of the image: unacceptable: 3 9.1%

Description of the arm and group: All subjects will undergo standard imaging on one breast. The other breast will be represented using patient-assisted compression (PAC), followed by technologist-controlled compression (TC).
• Technologist-controlled compression (TC): The compression of TC will be performed according to the standard of care practices at the site.
